p: Bioactive constituents are often attributed to the therapeutic effect of medicine plants [ 38]. Plants known to have antimalarial effect have been explored, and many secondary metabolites have been identified [ 39, 40]. In a previous study, the hydroalcoholic extract of the plant was screened for its phytochemical content and shown to have terpenoids, steroids, alkaloids, tannins, flavonoids, and polyphenol compounds [ 41]. Several studies have indicated that these metabolites have antiplasmodial activities. Considering these reports and the antiplasmodial activities of the plant seen in this study, the antiplasmodial effect of Leonotis ocymifolia may be attributed to its secondary metabolites.
